input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNE AND CITY OF RASZKÓW. Summary: Modernization of the Market Square in Raszków in Order to Reduce the Urban Heat Island Effect. Description: The subject of the order is the implementation of the task entitled: Modernization of the Market Square in Raszków in order to reduce the urban heat island effect. The scope of the order includes two stages: Description of the subject of the order, stage I: The subject of the order is the comprehensive implementation of the investment. in the Design and Build formula. Investment implementation is understood as the performance of all necessary works and activities, starting from design work, approval of design documentation, obtaining a building permit decision (or notification of construction or other construction works) to perform construction and installation works as well as finishing and assembly works indicated in the project in order to reduce the urban heat island effect. The subject of the order is the reconstruction of the main board of the Market Square and the strip parking lot in Raszków in terms of spatial functionality using elements of green and blue infrastructure. The investment area covers approximately 0.75 ha. Summary: Development of a "Comprehensive Plan for Adapting Otwock to Climate Change - Building Environmental Resilience and Safety of Residents.". Description: 4.1 The project titled The development of the Municipal Climate Change Adaptation Plan for the City of Otwock aims to create a comprehensive strategic document that will define actions and solutions enabling the city's adaptation to the effects of climate change. There will be a document takes into account the specificity of local environmental, social and economic conditions, as well as applicable national and international regulations and strategies. The scope of the document will be consistent with the provisions of the Act of April 27, 2001, Environmental Protection Law after the amendment of 2024, as well as with the guidelines for cities developed, among others, by the Institute of Environmental Protection, National Research Institute. The Municipal Climate Change Adaptation Plan will be prepared in accordance with the Adaptation Manual for Cities, guidelines for municipal preparation Climate change adaptation plan. The contractor will be obliged to have experts participate in committee meetings and sessions of the City Council when presenting the document and processing the resolution. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL VETERINARY INSTITUTE - NATIONAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE. Summary: High-Through-Through Metagenomic Sequencing with Library Preparation and Bioinformation Analysis. Description: The subject of the order is the following services: high-throughput metagenomic sequencing with library preparation and bioinformatic analysis. High-throughput metagenomic sequencing should be performed on the Illumina NovaSeq platform along with additional services, i.e. library preparation and bioinformatics analyses. Material: 20 DNA samples isolated from swabs from the respiratory tract of sheep. Expected number of samples: 20 samples, sent in a maximum of 2 tranches, with the possibility of expanding by 50%, i.e. increasing the number of samples to 30 samples. The Ordering Party provides for the option right referred to in Art. 441 section 1 point 1 of the Public Procurement Law, which provides for the possibility of increasing the order by 50%. Exercising the option right does not require changing the contract, but only informing the Contractor in writing. Samples are sent at the expense of the Service Provider. Dates of installments are agreed on an ongoing basis between the Ordering Party and the Contractor (planned Deadline for sending samples: December 2025/January 2026. Separate invoices delivered after each installment.. Published Date: 2025-12-04. Closing Date: 2025-12-11. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: NATIONAL VETERINARY INSTITUTE - NATIONAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE
output.Summary: High-Through-Through Metagenomic Sequencing with Library Preparation and Bioinformation Analysis

Material: 20 DNA samples isolated from swabs from the respiratory tract of sheep. The Ordering Party provides for the option right referred to in Art. 441 section 1 point 1 of the Public Procurement Law, which provides for the possibility of increasing the order by 50%. Exercising the option right does not require changing the contract, but only informing the Contractor in writing. Samples are sent at the expense of the Service Provider. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: WARSAW UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY. Summary: Pxrd Testing Service for Samples with Fe-Al Sprayed Coatings.. Description: The subject of the order is the service of PXRD testing of 20 samples of sprayed Fe-Al coatings along with the analysis of the results under the order no. ZP_37_2025_WMT_ITW conducted by the Faculty of Mechanical Technology of the Warsaw University of Technology with the conditions specified below. Sample dimensions: approx 20x20 mm, thick up to 10 mm. The Contractor is responsible for collecting samples from the Client. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE TREASURY PGL LP SZKLARSKA PORĘBA FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: Direct Monitoring of Predatory Mammals - Searching for Burns, Tracking on Transects in 2026 in the Szklarska Poreba Forest District. Description: The subject of the order is a service consisting in assessing the number and searching for burrows of predatory mammals within the black grouse refuge and in the 3 km buffer around them, in the Szklarska Poręba Forest District in 2026.<br> Monitoring areas covered by the provision of the service subject of the order, are located in the following forest districts: Kamienno, Orle, Zieleniec, Jakuszyce, Szklarska Poręba, Rozdroże, Roztoka, Szronowiec, Kamieńczyk. Due to the fact that the black grouse in accordance with the Regulation of the Minister of the Environment of December 16, 2016 on the protection of animal species (Journal of Laws of 2022 r., item 2380) is a strictly protected species, for security purposes, a list of its habitats will be presented to the Contractor within three (3) days from the date of conclusion of the contract.<br> The order is carried out as part of the project entitled: "Together for nature - protection of species and habitats in areas "naturally valuable" (OPL2). This order is co-financed by the European Union from the Cohesion Fund under the European Funds for Infrastructure, Climate, Environment 2021-2027 Program.<br> The description of the subject of the order is included in Volume III of the Specification of Conditions Orders.<br> DIRECT MONITORING OF PREDATORY MAMMALS - SEARCHING FOR BURNS, TRACKING ON TRANSECTS IN 2026 IN THE SZKLARSKA POREBA FOREST DISTRICT<br> The subject of the order is a service consisting in assessing the number and searching for burrows of predatory mammals within the black grouse refuge and w b.... Published Date: 2025-11-28. Closing Date: 2025-12-30. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PODKARPACKIE VOIVODESHIP. Summary: Evaluation Study. Description: The subject of the order is to perform an evaluation study entitled: Evaluation of the implementation of the equality principles adopted under the FEP 2021-2027. The main aim of the study is to assess the effectiveness and scope of implementation of equality principles, i.e. the principle of equal opportunities and non-discrimination, the principle of equality between women and men, as well as compliance with the provisions of the Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union and the Convention on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities under the regional program European Funds for Podkarpacie 2021-2027. The study aims to identify the extent to which these policies are improving the situation of vulnerable groups on discrimination in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship and identifying areas requiring further action. The description of the subject of the order is included in Appendix No. 5 to SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-11-27. Closing Date: 2025-12-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Evaluation Study

The study aims to identify the extent to which these policies are improving the situation of vulnerable groups on discrimination in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship and identifying areas requiring further action. Summary: Creation of Digital Transcriptions and Sheet Music Editions of Folk Music in Esac and Humdrum Formats, Along with Data Necessary to Conduct Computerized Analysis of the Repertoire and a Catalog of Melodies. Description: 1. The subject of the order is the creation of digital transcriptions and sheet music editions of folk music in EsAC and Humdrum formats, along with data necessary to conduct a computerized analysis of the repertoire and a catalog of melodies as part of the project "Polish musical culture in a European perspective - sources and contexts". Groundbreaking publications in the field of ethnomusicology by Oskar Kolberg, who collected approximately 26,000 folk melodies from all over Poland, will be digitized and processed. Copies of folk melodies will be encoded in EsAC and Humdrum formats, adapted to the needs of presentation and computerized music analysis and then making them available to a wide audience.<br> 2. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services. Description: The surveillance of the EU-s land and sea borders is a fundamental component of the European integrated Border Management (EIBM) as identified by the Multiannual Strategic Policy for EIBM 2023-2027 . Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT.... Published Date: 2025-11-19. Closing Date: 2025-11-24. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX)
output.Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services

Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT...

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: NATIONAL VETERINARY INSTITUTE - NATIONAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE. Summary: Genome Sequence Together with the Preparation of Libraries and Bioinformation Analysis". Description: The subject of the service is genomic sequencing, which will enable the detection of type A influenza viruses present in the tested samples, along with additional services, i.e. preparation of libraries and basic bioinformatic analysis. The expected number of samples is 10 samples. The Ordering Party provides for the right of option referred to in Art. 441 section 1 point 1 of the Public Procurement Law, which provides for the possibility of increasing the number of samples to a maximum of 15. Exercising the option does not require changing the contract, but only informing the Contractor in writing. The samples will be sent once (planned date of sending samples: November/December 2025) PCR product material after amplification of the entire genome of influenza A virus from samples from pigs (family: Orthomyxoviridae, genus: Influenzavirus A (genome size: approx. 14 kbp; 8 segments from 890 to 2341 bp)) Genome sequencing (genome in the form of a PCR product (DNA) composed of 8 separate segments).. Published Date: 2025-11-18. Closing Date: 2025-11-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Purchaser_Name: NATIONAL VETERINARY INSTITUTE - NATIONAL RESEARCH INSTITUTE
output.Summary: Genome Sequence Together with the Preparation of Libraries and Bioinformation Analysis"

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: ŁUKASIEWICZ RESEARCH NETWORK - INSTITUTE OF ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING. Summary: Tests of Composite Insulators 110Kv, 220Kv, 400Kv.. Description: The subject of the order is the purchase of research services: 1) Alternating voltage test at mains frequency in rain for insulators with a rated voltage of 110 kV and 220 kV and switching voltage test in rain for insulators with a rated voltage of 400 kV. As part of the test, the withstand voltage should be checked will determine the jump voltage. The test should be carried out in accordance with the requirements of PN-EN 61109, p. 11.1, according to the methodology given in PN-EN 60060-1, p. 6.3.2. Number of test objects: 400kV composite insulators 4 pieces, 220kV composite insulators 14 pieces, 110kV composite insulators 11 pieces. 2) Check boundary surfaces and connections - a test in the field of structural tests of composite linear insulators. The insulator should be checked by subjecting it to a steep-front impulse voltage test. This test should be carried out in accordance with the requirements specified in the PN-EN 62217 standard, section 9.2.7.3., but without carrying out tests preliminary to this trial. In this test, an impulse voltage of 2000 kV/s should be used. Number of test objects: Composite insulators 400kV 2 pieces, Composite insulators 220kV 7 pieces, Composite insulators 110kV 6 pcs.... Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-11-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Summary: Conducting 60 Idi Interviews as Part of the Research Project Entitled: "Skilled Workers from Ukraine on the Polish Labor Market. Employment Potential and Opportunities. Description: Detailed Description of the Subject of the Order consisting in conducting a qualitative study of in-depth IDI interviews with Ukrainian citizens working in Poland (n = 60) as part of a research project implemented by the Institute of Labor and Social Affairs entitled: Qualified Ukrainian workers on the Polish market work. Potential and employment opportunities financed from the state budget under the Science for Society II program, financed by the Ministry of Science and Higher Education. The aim of the study is to diagnose the professional situation of qualified and highly qualified citizens of Ukraine who stay in Poland. The research will cover people who have been living for at least 12 months in five large cities in Poland where the share of Ukrainian citizens is the highest: Warsaw, Łodź, Wroclaw, Krakow and Gdańsk, including people who arrived after the outbreak of the conflict with Russia in February 2022 year, as well as those who settled in our country earlier. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Open Market Consultation (Omc) for a Future Precommercial Procurement (Pcp) for the R&D (Research & Development) Services on Ict Tools for Energy Monitoring and Management. Description: A PIN announces the OMC of a future PCP for the development of ICT tools for energy monitoring and management. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best valueformoney solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a riskbenefit sharing under market conditions between the public procurer and the suppliers, and a clear separation between the PCP and the deployment of commercial volumes of endproducts. PCP procurement is exempted from the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), the EU public procurement directives and the national laws that implement them. Overall, the OMC aims to: (1) Validate the findings of the preliminary stateofthe art analysis and the viability of the set of technical and financial provisions. (2) Raise awareness of the industry and relevant stakeholders regarding the potential future PCP. (3) Collect insights from the industry and relevant stakeholders to finetune the tender specifications and publish a more qualitative tender. All OMC activities, including surveys, the Q&A document, webinars (dates and content) as well as registration information will be published for transparency purposes (Ogłoszenie o konsultacjach rynkowych dotyczących wyzwań badawczych z obszaru .... Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2025-12-14. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KRAKOW UNIVERSITY OF TECHNOLOGY TADEUSZ KOŚCIUSZKO. Summary: Carrying out Measurements with a Fwd (Hwd) Machine in 2025 - 2027. Description: The subject of this order is to perform measurements of FWD (HWD) machines. The measurement is intended to determine the load-bearing capacity of the railway track structure by recording the track deflection under dynamic load. Measurement and analysis should be performed in accordance with the principles contained in applicable standards and guidelines for tests with the FWD device. Spatial scope of the measurement covered by the order. The test will be carried out in two locations, a total of approximately 700 measurements, in accordance with this list: Test track in Migrodzie - approximately 400 measurements Euroterminal - approximately 300 measurements Other indicated place or places (crossings) railways).Method of measurement.The measurement should be performed using a FWD (Falling Weight Deflectometer) or HWD (Heavy Weight Deflectometer) device that records the deflection of the railway surface under dynamic load. A detailed description of the subject of the order is included in Annex No. 1 to this SWZ Detailed Description of the Subject of the Order and Annex No. 4 to the SWZ Draft contract.. Published Date: 2025-10-25. Closing Date: 2025-11-04. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT. Summary: Open Market Consultation (Omc) for a Future Precommercial Procurement (Pcp) for the R&D (Research & Development) Services on Ict Tools for Energy Monitoring and Management. Description: A PIN announces the OMC of a future PCP for the development of ICT tools for energy monitoring and management. PCP is an approach that allows public procurers to buy R&D from several competing suppliers in parallel, to compare alternative solution approaches, and to identify the best valueformoney solutions that the market can deliver to address their needs. It is split into three phases: solution design, prototype implementation, and validation and demonstration of the solutions. In PCP, there is a riskbenefit sharing under market conditions between the public procurer and the suppliers, and a clear separation between the PCP and the deployment of commercial volumes of endproducts. PCP procurement is exempted from the WTO Government Procurement Agreement (GPA), the EU public procurement directives and the national laws that implement them. Overall, the OMC aims to: (1) Validate the findings of the preliminary stateofthe art analysis and the viability of the set of technical and financial provisions. (2) Raise awareness of the industry and relevant stakeholders regarding the potential future PCP. (3) Collect insights from the industry and relevant stakeholders to finetune the tender specifications and publish a more qualitative tender. All OMC activities, including surveys, the Q&A document, webinars (dates and content) as well as registration information will be published for transparency purposes (Ogłoszenie o konsultacjach rynkowych dotyczących wyzwań badawczych z obszaru .... Published Date: 2025-10-23. Closing Date: 2025-12-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services. Description: The surveillance of the EU-s land and sea borders is a fundamental component of the European integrated Border Management (EIBM) as identified by the Multiannual Strategic Policy for EIBM 2023-2027 . Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT.... Published Date: 2025-10-16. Closing Date: 2025-11-20. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

output.Purchaser_Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX)
output.Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services

Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT...

instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: EUROPEAN BORDER AND COAST GUARD AGENCY (FRONTEX). Summary: Shipborne Vtol Uas Deployment with Data Fusion and Integration Services. Description: The surveillance of the EU-s land and sea borders is a fundamental component of the European integrated Border Management (EIBM) as identified by the Multiannual Strategic Policy for EIBM 2023-2027 . Border surveillance requires effective operational measures taken by Frontex and Member States- border management authorities. The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT.... Published Date: 2025-10-13. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: European Border and Coast Guard Agency (Frontex)

The Technical and Operational Strategy for EIBM states that these measures should be intelligence-driven and risk-based, drawing on multi-domain sensor networks. The multipurpose surveillance-oriented approach, as described in the Capability Roadmap of the EBCG , will require the deployment of integrated, interoperable and inter-connected capabilities that will enable persistent border surveillance, including unmanned systems such as UAS and satellites. Integrated solution for border surveillance combining shipborne Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) with Vertical Take-off and Landing (VTOL) with data fusion and integration from additional sources has the objective to provide an enhanced level of detail and accuracy in understanding border activity, thereby enabling more effective surveillance and response. Based on operational capability requirements and previous research efforts, through this Pilot Project the Agency intends to continue evaluating unmanned systems technologies and their capabilities in delivering integrated aerial maritime surveillance, while assessing operational performance, cost-efficiency, and reliability. <br> Doc Title: Shipborne VT...
